commands.name: init
commands.short: Initialises pgstream, creating the replication slot and the relevant tables/functions/triggers under the configured internal pgstream schema
commands.example:
pgstream init --postgres-url <source-postgres-url> --replication-slot <replication-slot-name>
	pgstream init -c config.yaml
	pgstream init -c config.env

flags.name: postgres-url
flags.description: Source postgres URL where pgstream setup will be run

flags.name: replication-slot
flags.description: Name of the postgres replication slot to be created by pgstream on the source url

commands.name: run
commands.short: Run starts a continuous data stream from the configured source to the configured target
commands.example:
pgstream run --source postgres --source-url <source-postgres-url> --target postgres --target-url <target-postgres-url>
	pgstream run --source postgres --source-url <source-postgres-url> --target postgres --target-url <target-postgres-url> --snapshot-tables <schema.table> --reset
	pgstream run --source kafka --source-url <kafka-url> --target elasticsearch --target-url <elasticsearch-url>
	pgstream run --source postgres --source-url <postgres-url> --target kafka --target-url <kafka-url>
	pgstream run --config config.yaml --log-level info
	pgstream run --config config.env

flags.name: replication-slot
flags.description: Name of the postgres replication slot for pgstream to connect to

flags.name: reset
flags.description: Wether to reset the target before snapshotting (only for postgres target)

flags.name: snapshot-tables
flags.description: List of tables to snapshot if initial snapshot is required, in the format <schema>.<table>. If not specified, the schema `public` will be assumed. Wildcards are supported

flags.name: source
flags.description: Source type. One of postgres, kafka

flags.name: source-url
flags.description: Source URL

flags.name: target
flags.description: Target type. One of postgres, opensearch, elasticsearch, kafka

flags.name: target-url
flags.description: Target URL

commands.name: snapshot
commands.short: Snapshot performs a snapshot of the configured source Postgres database into the configured target
commands.example:
pgstream snapshot --postgres-url <postgres-url> --target postgres --target-url <target-url> --tables <schema.table> --reset
	pgstream snapshot --config config.yaml --log-level info
	pgstream snapshot --config config.env

flags.name: postgres-url
flags.description: Source postgres database to perform the snapshot from

flags.name: reset
flags.description: Wether to reset the target before snapshotting (only for postgres target)

flags.name: tables
flags.description: List of tables to snapshot, in the format <schema>.<table>. If not specified, the schema `public` will be assumed. Wildcards are supported

flags.name: target
flags.description: Target type. One of postgres, opensearch, elasticsearch, kafka

flags.name: target-url
flags.description: Target URL

commands.name: status
commands.short: Checks the status of pgstream initialisation and provided configuration
commands.example:
pgstream status -c pg2pg.env
	pgstream status --postgres-url <postgres-url> --replication-slot <replication-slot-name>
	pgstream status -c pg2pg.yaml --json

flags.name: json
flags.description: Output the status in JSON format

flags.name: postgres-url
flags.description: Source postgres URL where pgstream has been initialised

flags.name: replication-slot
flags.description: Name of the postgres replication slot created by pgstream on the source url

commands.name: tear-down
commands.short: It tears down any pgstream setup, removing the replication slot and all the relevant tables/functions/triggers, along with the internal pgstream schema
commands.example:
pgstream tear-down --postgres-url <source-postgres-url> --replication-slot <replication-slot-name>
	pgstream tear-down -c config.yaml
	pgstream tear-down -c config.env

flags.name: postgres-url
flags.description: Source postgres URL where pgstream tear down will be run

flags.name: replication-slot
flags.description: Name of the postgres replication slot to be deleted by pgstream from the source url

flags.name: config
flags.description: .env or .yaml config file to use with pgstream if any

flags.name: log-level
flags.description: log level for the application. One of trace, debug, info, warn, error, fatal, panic
